text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
MATERIAL CHANGES

IRM 8.20.10.2.2, ACDS Tour of Duty (TOD) is updated to include Maxiflex Full-Time and Maxiflex Part-Time per deployment of Appeals Work Request (AWR) 333, ACDS E-Mail No. 2015-02 - ACDS Partial Code Deployment Version 17.01 20150526. (12) is added to identify and clarify the PTM responsibilities for their respective APS employees’ PEAS timesheet management.
IRM 8.20.10.3, PEAS Permission Levels is changed to correct the PEAS Permission Level for the APS Program Analyst account.
IRM 8.20.10.3.1, (2500) Processing Employee Automated System (PEAS) Permission, is updated to identify the specific ACDS employee types with this PEAS permission level.

IRM 8.20.10.6.2.2.4, PEAS Suspense from Full Update, (6) table IRM references are updated or added. (7) table “Manual Refund” monitoring requirement is added per request from APS Senior Technical Analyst. (7) table “Quick Assessment” monitoring requirement is added per request APS Senior Technical Advisor. Instead of closing PEAS upon receipt of the Form 3552, Prompt Assessment Billing Assembly with a complete Document Locator Number, APS must now and monitor the taxpayer’s account every 10 work days until the quick assessment transactions fully posted before PEAS can be closed.
IRM 8.20.10.6.3, Processing Employee Automated System (PEAS) Alert Form instructions are updated and (6) IRM citation is updated.

IRM 8.20.10.7, PEAS Reports, (7)c) and (8)d) are added to clarify that cases with a Feature Code of PC and a PEAS Date Received less than 30 days are excluded from the modified the PEAS ACDS OverAge Inventory and IDRS OverAge Inventory as of May 26, 2015 with the deployment of AWR 212. PEAS Reports are listed in the order they appear on the PEAS Reports menu. Report names are added in ( ) following each title for clarification. Details related to search parameter options and report results are included when applicable. Plain Language Writing Style updates are also made throughout this subsection.
IRM 8.20.10.8, IRM Deviation Procedures is added to provide guidance and the IRM citation for IRS policy to follow for requesting an approved deviation from the published IRM procedures.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
AUDIENCE
Appeals
Appeals Processing Employee Automated System (PEAS)
Table of Contents
Processing Employee Automated System 8.20.10
) The Processing Employee Automated System (PEAS) is an automated within the Appeals Centralized Database System (ACDS). This system is designed to: (cid:
) Control inventory assigned to an Account and Processing Support employee (cid:
) Control unassigned inventory (cid:
) Control inventory assigned to processing personnel and any employee assisting APS with processing their work (i.e. Secretaries) (cid:
) Provide reports (cid:
) Provide inventory listings (cid:
) Provide a daily timesheet (cid:
) Track direct and indirect time (cid:
) Track cycle time (cid:
) Provide statistical reports on inventory and time utilization for evaluative purposes and for determining staffing needs (cid:
) Generate performance evaluations, mid-year reviews and live case (
) For additional information on the ACDS code definitions used within this see IRM
, Account and Processing Support (APS), Appeals Database System (ACDS). (
) If an employee has PEAS permission(s), the program systemically includes certain cases in that employees’ PEAS inventory, if one of the following menu options was used: (cid:
) I. Input Case/Returns (cid:

Close ALL Cases in WUNO (cid:

) At the end of each month, PEAS month-end processing will take place. will produce statistical inventory reports for purposes of evaluating achieve- ment of program goals and determining proper staffing needs. (
) ACDS account information must be verified and corrected, if necessary, to ensure that PEAS functions as it is intended. In particular, the following are required:
User must have an APS ACDS account.

Processing Team Manager (APS PTM) must verify the list of included in their team in the Personnel Profile. The list must include all APS employees in the team and any non-APS employee with a ing Support account who performs some APS duties within the AOC(s) which the APS PTM is responsible.
PEAS employees must verify their contact information in the Personnel Profile.
APS PTM must ensure that each employee in their list has the correct tour-of-duty.
PEAS permissions must be added to the user’s ACDS profile.

duty. PEAS permissions must be added to the user’s ACDS profile.
8.20 Account and Processing Support (APS)

) The APS PTM must review their Personnel Profile within ACDS to whether all employees in the team are listed. Follow these steps to review Profile profile and make corrections, if any: a. Click on the “Personnel” button in ACDS b. Click on “Update Profile For: (Your Name)” from the Personnel menu c. Click on “Employees” from your User Profile d. Move available employees to or from the list of employees using the and right arrows e. Verify that all employees in the team are listed in the box labeled “Employees” f. Click on Submit Update (

) Each employee with a Processing Support account must also review their ACDS Personnel Profile for accuracy. PEAS uses the ACDS Personnel to provide contact information to others who research a PEAS case, so it particularly important to verify the accuracy of the work phone, fax, e-mail work address. (

) The APS PTM must ensure that every employee in their group has a tour duty (TOD) on ACDS as follows: a. Click on the TOD hyperlink from the User Profile for the employee, b. Review the TOD information on the employee’s summary screen for accuracy. (
) If the TOD exists but is incorrect click on the hyperlink to Update the TOD take the following action as appropriate: (cid:
) Click on the Delete hyperlink to delete an erroneous TOD, or (cid:
) Click on the Add Tour of Duty if the employee’s TOD does not exist or changed. (
) From the “Add Tour of Duty” input screen, select a TOD from the list: (cid:

) Enter an effective date for the TOD. The effective date should be a date to the first date of a pay period. This date must precede the first day of the month that the employee is required to complete a PEAS timesheet. (
TOD requires the following entries: (cid:

hour day within the pay period beginning with the effective date, in MM/DD/YYYY format.

) The PTM is responsible for ensuring that their APS employees: (cid:

) Non-APS employees with a Processing Support ACDS account have the to do processing work part-time. Special PEAS procedures apply to these with employees. (
) The local APS PTM must include the non-APS employees in their list on ACDS with a part-time ACDS TOD. The part-time TOD allows them record direct time on cases. (
) All Account and Processing Support (APS) employees have access to The availability of functions within PEAS is dependent upon the level of the user. (

) A message is displayed on the employee’s ACDS Home page to indicate activity records (CARs) that were viewed or updated by a manager or lead. clicking the button on the Home Page labeled “CARs accessed”, the user is provided a list of cases accessed. The list headings are: (cid:
) TPNAME - the name of the case accessed (cid:
) Type - Viewed, if the record accessed was viewed, or New if a comment was added to the record accessed. Manager/Admin - the name of the person who accessed the record (cid:
) Date - the date of access (cid:
) Comment - the text of the comment up to XXX characters, if a comment was added (
) Click on the TPNAME hyperlink to view details of the access, and then “Remove from Active List”, “Keep on Active List” or “View CAR” (if available) clicking the corresponding button. (

) When the Appeals Team Manager (ATM) approves the case and enters the ATM Approval Date (ACAPDATE) on ACDS, the case is systemically to PEAS based on the Direct Ship Configuration Table designation for each Post of Duty (POD). The SHIPPED Action Code is automatically populated identify which APS Office is assigned the case. The ATE/ATM then transmits the case to APS. (cid:
) If the ATM is not co-located with the designated APS Team, the case is transmitted to APS using Form
, Document Transmittal. ment of receipt by APS transfers statute responsibility to the APS PTM. (cid:
) If the ATM is co-located with APS, the statute responsibility immediately transfers when the case is delivered to APS. (cid:
) Upon assignment of the case to an APS TE, statute responsibility is by the PTM and the APS TE until the assessment is fully posted to the payer’s account. (

PEAS is used to control various types of assigned and unassigned inventory.
8.20 Account and Processing Support (APS)
) A case is in APS inventory when received in APS, regardless of whether it is controlled on PEAS. (
) A case should be entered on PEAS within
hours of receipt or as soon as possible after receipt. (
) There are a number of methods to enter a case on PEAS. The following options are used to enter a case on PEAS and are discussed in more detail later in this chapter. (cid:
) Import and Assign – allows managers and leads to import and assign a case, and allows APS employees to import and self-assign a case. (cid:
) Fast Import for Closing - WUNO – allows managers and leads to import case(s) by workunit number into unassigned inventory for closing. (cid:
) Fast Import for Closing - DKTNO – allows managers and leads to case(s) by docket number into unassigned inventory for closing. (cid:
) Fast Import for Non-Closing – allows managers and leads to import case(s) by workunit number into unassigned inventory for other than closing. (
) Unassigned: Until a case is assigned to an APS employee, the APS PTM statute responsibility. and (

) Assigned: The APS PTM assigns inventory to the APS employee. The APS Inventory PTM may delegate responsibility for assigning inventory to an Acting APS or lead tax examiner. At least one APS employee in each post of duty is delegated responsibility to assign inventory. (
) The PEAS Main Menu is accessed by clicking the APS button in ACDS. (
) The menu options available from the PEAS Main Menu vary according to the Menus

8.20 Account and Processing Support (APS)
The APS PTM or APS TE with Lead permissions, can update their own case and any case that belongs to the team, assigned or unassigned.
The PEAS Update screen offers an option for either a limited view or full view of the ACDS CASES information to identify the PEAS case.
To return from full view to limited view, the user should click on the button labeled “Show Limited Case Data”.

An unassigned AIVP Blank None case with Type Code of AIVP is created and placed in the default APS PTM’s Inbox on PEAS to request an update to the statute date on AIMS. (5) PEAS Feature Codes (cid:129) AT Account Transfer (cid:129) CA Closing Agreement (cid:129) CS Customer Service work (cid:129) GT GATT case (cid:129) MR Manual Refund (cid:129) PA Premature Assessment (cid:129) PC Post Closure work (cid:129) SP Special Project (6) PEAS Case Grade defaults to a grade 6 and can only be changed to a higher grade by PTM or TE with Lead Permissions. PEAS cases are graded according to the complexity of the work, and may be graded 6, 7, 8 or 9. (7) Assigned is the date the case is assigned to the employee. (8) Employee defaults to the name of the person importing the case, and can only be changed by the PTM or TE with Lead Permissions. (9) Priority is used to identify a specific priority on the case from a drop-down list of options. ) A button labeled “Case is Not in PEAS Suspense” is displayed when the is not currently in suspense. Clicking on this button will display prior PEAS suspense records. (

) Any case with PEAS Type Code CLS may be put in PEAS suspense. To create a PEAS suspense record from Update Case/Time, select the button labeled “Suspense” on the bottom of the screen. The “Date In” will default to the current date. “Date Out” will default to blank, and should remain blank the user closes the suspense record by inputting a date equal to the date suspense period ends. “Notes” may be input if needed. Processing Employee Automated System 8.20.10
All Non-AIMS Adjustments must be suspensed and monitored until they are fully posted on TXMODA in compliance with IRM

, Un- postable Closings. APS TEs are encouraged to systemically set a Suspense and Monitor Follow-up Date in PEAS instead of maintaining a hard copy “monitor folder”. APS PTMs and Leads can access the PEAS Suspense Reports for their Team or for an individual TE.
Example: A Non-AIMS Adjustment (TC

Tax Abatement) input on Monday - Wednesday of a given cycle, may be in PN (pending status) by the following Monday. The TE can use IDRS CC: RECON to force the ad- justment to post and then close their PEAS Suspense Record. For additional information about IDRS CC: RECON, see IRM
, IDRS Terminal Responses, Command Codes MFREQ and RECON.
Reminder: In addition to the mandatory monitoring requirement for all Non-AIMS account actions, certain processing actions on AIMS cases also have mandatory monitor and follow-up requirements:

ADJUSTMENT TYPE IRM REFERENCE AQMS Selected Cases IRM 8.20.7.2.2, AQMS Cases Closed on ACDS and Processed by APS Manual Refund (cid:129) IRM 4.4.19.15, Follow-up (cid:129) IRM 21.4.4.5.1, Monitoring Manual Refunds Multi-step Adjustments Cases requiring multi-step adjustment processing should be closed on ACDS (ACKCLS) and put in PEAS Suspense for monitoring as required. Quick Assessment (cid:129) IRM 3.17.244.2.7(1) d, Reviewing Quick, Prompt, Jeopardy, and Termination Assessment Requests (cid:129) IRM 4.4.25.14, Quick Assessment Verification Form 3552, CCP or Campus Examination Procedures (cid:129) IRM 8.20.7.4, Expedite Processing for Certain Large Dollar Cases >$100,000 Unpostable Team Adjustments All unpostables corrected by the Unpostable Team must be placed in
All unpostables corrected by the Unpostable Team must be placed in PEAS suspense and monitored until all transactions have posted.

ype will be PIPELINE (cid:

Note: See IRM 8.1.9.2, AARS Customer Service Referrals for information on cases that an Appeals Account Resolution Specialist (AARS) returns to Account and Processing Support (APS).
See IRM

, AARS Customer Service Referrals for information on that an Appeals Account Resolution Specialist (AARS) returns to Account and Processing Support (APS). When a field or campus office closes a case, the ATM inputs an ATM (ACAPDATE) date which drops the case into PEAS. The PEAS Received is populated when the ACAPDATE is entered, even though the case may not actually be received by APS on that date. This case then becomes part of APS inventory and must be assigned to an APS employee. This action the timeframe for APS processing. When a case with an ACAPDATE is not timely received, the APS PTM will prepare a PEAS Alert Form and attach it to the email notification to the ATM outlined below. Generate the PEAS Alert Form using ACDS as follows:
From the ACDS Home Page Click on the APGOLF Button.
Click on the Forms and Letters Index in the APGOLF window. ▼
Click on the next to the Select Category Drop Down Menu and Processing.
Click on the PEAS Alert Form in the Select Form/Letter Window.
Generate a blank PEAS Alert Form, or select the case on ACDS which auto-populate the case specific information.
Complete the remaining entries on the PEAS Alert Form and click on Generate Form button.
Click on the Print Forms hyperlink in the APGolf menu on the left side the screen to open the Print Window. Do not use the Print option in ACDS.
Select Adobe PDF in the Select Printer Options list to create a pdf file the PEAS Alert Form.
Click on “Apply”, then “Print”.
Identify where you want the file saved and name the file, click OK to
When a case with an ACAPDATE is not timely received, the APS PTM will prepare a PEAS Alert Form and attach it to the email notification to the ATM

From the ACDS Home Page Click on the APGOLF Button. Click on the Forms and Letters Index in the APGOLF window. ▼ Click on the next to the Select Category Drop Down Menu and Processing. Click on the PEAS Alert Form in the Select Form/Letter Window. Generate a blank PEAS Alert Form, or select the case on ACDS which auto

populate the case specific information. Complete the remaining entries on the PEAS Alert Form and click on Generate Form button. Click on the Print Forms hyperlink in the APGolf menu on the left side the screen to open the Print Window. Do not use the Print option in ACDS. Select Adobe PDF in the Select Printer Options list to create a pdf file the PEAS Alert Form. Click on “Apply”, then “Print”. Identify where you want the file saved and name the file, click OK to complete the save and file naming step.

Reminder: Use the WUNO for the filename because the WUNO is not considered PII, and provides a consistent file naming convention as well as a unique identifier for each PEAS Alert Form, each recipient and each responsible party.
With the completed PEAS Alert Form on your screen, click on the FILE button in the Tool Bar Menu and then click on Attach to Email.
An email will open with your PEAS Alert Form attached. (See the If Table below and address your email accordingly).

With the completed PEAS Alert Form on your screen, click on the FILE button in the Tool Bar Menu and then click on Attach to Email. An email will open with your PEAS Alert Form attached. (See the If Then Table below and address your email accordingly).
Reminder: The PEAS Alert Form information contains PII which requires the email to be encrypted.

a. If the ATM finds the case, the original ACAPDATE will not change and ATM will immediately send the case to APS using Form

, Document Transmittal. The ATM will communicate with all parties to let them know the case has been found and update the PEAS Alert Form to record where and when the case was found. b. If APS finds the case, the original ACAPDATE will not change. APS will communicate with all parties to let them know the case has been found and update the PEAS Alert Form to record where and when the case found. c. If the case cannot be found by the

th day, the field will coordinate with APS and recreate the case. The SOA will work with the Director of APS, determine the appropriate ACAPDATE (the original date or a new date depending upon circumstances).

) This function allows the employee the option to view or print their monthly timesheet for either the current or prior months. a (
) The PTM or employee with Lead permissions can view or print a the current month or a prior month, for any employee in the team by the name from the drop-down list. (

) The default setting is for the current month sorted by assigned date. The may change the settings to select a prior month, if available, and/or the sort to “Sort by TP”. The user may select the desired settings from drop-down lists. If the settings are changed, the user must click on the (G)enerate timesheet button to refresh the page. (

) When the timesheet is initially viewed on-screen, the case names are Clicking the push button labeled “Show Cases” displays the case names viewing. Clicking the button labeled “Hide Cases” hides the case names viewing. The case names are listed when the timesheet is printed. (

) Clicking the button labeled “Display [Month Year] for Printing” results in print options page. The user may accept the default settings or choose the available options. The default settings are to print zeroes as dashes, one separator line between cases, and not print the indirect hours details page. Clicking the (P)rint button loads the printable version of the the screen for printing. (

) The printable version of the timesheet includes a “BALANCED FOR indicator at the bottom of the page. The indicator is either “Y” for “Yes, balanced” or “N” for “No, not balanced”. A PEAS user that is required to balance a timesheet must balance each day and have a “Y” indicator on day prior to month-end processing. (

) APS PTMs and/or employee with Lead permissions have the following functions available to them on PEAS: to a. View the employee’s case activity b. Check for unbalanced days c. Add non-TOD reservations

Processing Employee Automated System 8.20.10 page (1) APS managers have additional menu items to assist in assigning and ing inventory within their group. Managers (2) Where there are multiple processing teams in one location, the employees be assigned by group to their APS PTM. This will allow reports to be generated by employee and by group. PEAS Menu Item Description Assign Cases Appears only when there are cases to be assigned along with the number of cases to be assigned. Fast Import for Closing -WUNO Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import cases for closing into PEAS inventory. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory with PEAS type. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit. Fast Import for Non-Closing Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import -DKTNO cases for closing into PEAS inventory by docket number. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory, with PEAS type CLS. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit. Fast Import for Non-Closing Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import cases for other than closing action into PEAS inventory by workunit number. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory, with PEAS type OTH. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit. Reassign Case Provides the ability to reassign a PEAS case from one PEAS employee in the team to another PEAS employee. Requires APS PTM or employee with lead permissions within the same team. Special functionality is available for co-located campus teams which allows reassignment between groups. Transfer Case Provides the ability to transfer a PEAS case from one PEAS office to another PEAS office nationwide. Check INBOX Displays and a number appears if cases are being transferred to your office. Check OUTBOX Displays and a number appears when there are cases being trans- ferred from the office. The user can recall an erroneously transferred case up until the time the case is accepted by the receiving office. Manager proxy administration Allows the APS PTM to designate an employee as an acting manager. Based on the dates entered, the manager functionality is given to the designated employee. At the end date the manager permissions are removed automatically.
Processing Employee Automated System 8.20.10

Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import cases for closing into PEAS inventory. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory with PEAS type. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit.

Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import cases for closing into PEAS inventory by docket number. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory, with PEAS type CLS. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit.

Allows the APS PTM or employee with lead permissions to import cases for other than closing action into PEAS inventory by workunit number. The case is placed in the PEAS unassigned inventory, with PEAS type OTH. The user can import all cases and/or returns for the workunit.

Provides the ability to reassign a PEAS case from one PEAS employee in the team to another PEAS employee. Requires APS PTM or employee with lead permissions within the same team. Special functionality is available for co-located campus teams which allows reassignment between groups.

The PEAS Follow-Up List can be used to set reminders for a variety of APS PEAS inventory management related actions:
PEAS inventory management related actions: (cid:
) Daily, weekly, or monthly report actions (cid:
) PEAS case monitoring actions (cid:

) Requests from the Lead or PTM to update the PEAS Case Activity Record (CAR) for case status which eliminates the need for email traffic on case related communications and consolidates case related comments within PEAS CAR (cid:
) Reminders to follow-up with the ATE, TCS, Counsel, or other contact information is needed to process or otherwise complete a case related action (cid:

) PEAS Suspense monitoring reminders (this eliminates the need for a suspense and monitor file) Statute Report - (Statute Expiration Report) This report provides a list of cases with statute dates up to the “Statute date” entered. Based on permissions, a statute report can be created for any of the following parameters: a. Area - All or by each Processing Area b. AIMS Office Code (AOC) c. Post of Duty (POD) d. Group e. APS Employee f. STATCODE parameters choices: Exclude TBOR

, CSED and XCSED, or ALL g. STATCODE XXXXXX (Other as locally defined) h. Statute through date i. Include SN/Court Entered PEAS j. Include PEAS with closing codes IVL Report - (PEAS Inventory List) This report provides a PEAS inventory list for all cases in the PEAS users’ inventory based on the search parameters entered. A PEAS Inventory List be created for any of the following: (cid:
) All PEAS employees on the team - the manager or lead has permission to generate a combined inventory listing that includes all cases in the team’s inventory. (cid:

) Individual PEAS employee by name - the manager or lead has permission to generate an individual listing for any employee on the team and the employee has permission to generate his or her own inventory listing. Report parameters are set as one of the following options: Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

Report results will Include open PEAS cases with no open returns if the box checked.
Additional PEAS Inventory List information:

a. This report is for use during the annual physical inventory validation or as directed by management. b. The format of the report is consistent with the IVL reports generated for Appeals Technical Employees (ATE). c. There is an option to include closed cases in inventory by clicking the box to insert a check mark when running the report. The default setting is blank, which does not include closed cases in inventory.
